body_html:
Sorry. I just found out that it is because the two computing nodes run at different speeds even though they have identical hardware and OS. The newer version, v0.2.0_1, is in fact about 3% faster than the old version v0.1.12_2 when tested on the same computing node.

Tested on the same node:
v0.1.12_2:
Epoch 10, 12250/12296; acc: 48.12; ppl: 14.84; 6130 src tok/s; 4211 tgt tok/s; 50244 s elapsed

v0.2.0_1:
Epoch 10, 12250/12296; acc: 48.48; ppl: 14.59; 6452 src tok/s; 4423 tgt tok/s; 48870 s elapsed

Not sure what you guys have found out.

body:
Sorry. I just found out that it is because the two computing nodes run at different speeds even though they have identical hardware and OS. The newer version, v0.2.0_1, is in fact about 3% faster than the old version v0.1.12_2 when tested on the same computing node.

Tested on the same node:
**v0.1.12_2:**
Epoch 10, 12250/12296; acc:  48.12; ppl:  14.84; 6130 src tok/s; 4211 tgt tok/s;  50244 s elapsed

**v0.2.0_1:**
Epoch 10, 12250/12296; acc:  48.48; ppl:  14.59; 6452 src tok/s; 4423 tgt tok/s;  48870 s elapsed

Not sure what you guys have found out.
